speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: SCENE I. A room in the castle.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter a King and a Queen very lovingly; the Queen  embracing him, and he her. She kneels, and makes a show of protestation unto him. He takes her up,  and declines his head upon her neck: lays him down  upon a bank of flowers: she, seeing him asleep,  leaves him. Anon comes in a fellow, takes off his  crown, kisses it, and pours poison in the King's  ears, and exit. The Queen returns; finds the King  dead, and makes passionate action. The Poisoner,  with some two or three Mutes, comes in again,  seeming to lament with her. The dead body is  carried away. The Poisoner wooes the Queen with  gifts: she seems loath and unwilling awhile, but in the end accepts his love

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: There's matter in these sighs, these profound heaves:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: You must translate: 'tis fit we understand them.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Where is your son?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Bestow this place on us a little while.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Ah, my good lord, what have I seen to-night!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: What, Gertrude? How does Hamlet?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Mad as the sea and wind, when both contend

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Which is the mightier: in his lawless fit,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Behind the arras hearing something stir,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Whips out his rapier, cries, 'A rat, a rat!'

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: And, in this brainish apprehension, kills

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: The unseen good old man.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: O heavy deed!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: It had been so with us, had we been there:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: His liberty is full of threats to all;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To you yourself, to us, to every one.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Alas, how shall this bloody deed be answer'd?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: It will be laid to us, whose providence

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Should have kept short, restrain'd and out of haunt,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: This mad young man: but so much was our love,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: We would not understand what was most fit;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: But, like the owner of a foul disease,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To keep it from divulging, let it feed

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Even on the pith of Life. Where is he gone?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: To draw apart the body he hath kill'd:

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: O'er whom his very madness, like some ore

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Among a mineral of metals base,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Shows itself pure; he weeps for what is done.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: O Gertrude, come away!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: The sun no sooner shall the mountains touch,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: But we will ship him hence: and this vile deed

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: We must, with all our majesty and skill,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Both countenance and excuse. Ho, Guildenstern!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Re-enter ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Friends both, go join you with some further aid:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Hamlet in madness hath Polonius slain,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And from his mother's closet hath he dragg'd him:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Go seek him out; speak fair, and bring the body

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Into the chapel. I pray you, haste in this.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Come, Gertrude, we'll call up our wisest friends;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And let them know, both what we mean to do,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And what's untimely done. O, come away!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: My soul is full of discord and dismay.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
